name: Community clean up
description:
Tackle the war on waste and join passionate volunteers in cleaning streets, beaches and waterways. 

Get out and about, pick up litter and prevent it from entering the environment. Raise awareness on waste pollution and promote circular economy – where everything is a resource, and there is no such thing as waste.

name: Teach
description:
Have the chance to shape and redirect someone's future into something brighter and better. Become a volunteer teacher today and help out at schools where teachers are a limited, stretched ourt resource.  You can choose to teach locally or overseas. If overseas, you can teach in some of the world’s most beautiful and remote locations like Laos, Costa Rica or Thailand. 

Please note you might be required to complete a Police Clearance, or a National Background Check or Working with Children check where necessary, and to comply by the policy.

name: Participate in fundraiser
description: Love interacting with people, talking and pitching? You might enjoy particpating in fundraising events such as appeals, auctions, raffles etc. This is a great opportunity to work for your favourite charities and non-profit and rally for funds!

name: Animal welfare
description:
Help lost and abandoned animals and give them a better chance in life. Animal welfare organisations vary from dogs and cats shelter all the way through animal sanctuaries to rescuing wildlife from circus and shows. 

Some of the activities you could do: 
- instead of buying a dog, you can opt for adopting. You can help care by fostering dogs and cats while they await new homes. 
- volunteer at shelters
- work at wildlife rescue facilities overseas
- If you're a vet, use your skills to treat and nurse animals to full health

name: Emergency support in fire, floods, disaster
description: Support people impacted by disasters. You'll provide crucial support to people in the community who are impacted by an emergency like floods, fire or the pandemic. Depending on the role, you may need to go through assessments and training. You could be assisting with building and maintenance, providing food and shelters, or social support and visiting those impacted by the event.

name: Take care of elderly
description: Did you know that 1 in 4 Australians struggle with loneliness? We can all agree that's too many! Make a difference to older people's lives by spending quality time with them, talking, listening, playing games. You can host fitness and dancing class, take part in gardening and flower arranging, social visits, music and sing-alongs or arts and craft activities.

name: Help homeless
description: You can make a difference to the most vulnerable community members by helping those sleeping rough. There are so many ways to get involved. You can provide admin support, become a shop assistants at op shops, or register for shift works that provide cleaning service like shower operation and washing while you engage in genuine, non-judgmental conversations with them.

name: Community gardening
description: If you enjoy being outdoor, growing and potting plants, and getting your hands dirty, it's time to join community gardening! Community gardens and city farms are places where people come together to grow fresh food, to learn, relax and make new friends. The gardens are found across Australia in big cities and country towns, in public parks and school grounds, and in other places. They offer fresh food and learning at the same time as they create a sense of place close to where the gardeners live. It's a perfect opportunity to connect with locals in your area, learn new skills, give back and care for your wellbeing (social connection and being in nature do wonders for our health!)

name: Help disabled people
description: Make a difference by supporting disability services. You can get involved through home and living support, social and community participation, therapeutic support, children's services, event coordination etc.

name: Donate blood
description: Are you 18-75 years old, healthy and weigh over 50 kg? You might be able to donate blood. Right now, due to Covid-19, 1 in 2 donors are unable to make appointments due to isolation so we need you more than ever! You will need to take some assessments to see if you're eligible to give blood. If you can, you can choose between giving blood or plasma and help give life to those who need it urgently!

name: Become an activist
description: Are you passionate and committed to a cause you care about? It's time to engage and inspire others by taking action, raising awareness of the cause and lobbying those in decision making positions. You can learn how to campaign, connect with like-minded people and create change. Join forces with others and make a bigger impact through scale. This can be done for any causes you care about, be it animal justice, women's rights, climate change and so on. The list is endless!

name: Skill-based volunteers
description:
Are you an accountant, software engineer, legal advisor, marketing specialist? Do you work in office-based role? You could lend a hand offering your professional skills to non-profits. Non-profits engage professionals with specialised skills to help them build capacity to do what they do, better. Skill based volunteers can assist in many areas of your organisation such as:

Workshop facilitation
Project management
Strategic planning
Change management
HR policy and process
IT scoping and advice
Performance reviews
Advising your board
Communications and marketing.

Volunteering can also be virtual so it's flexible and accessible for anyone!

name: Get involved in the arts
description: If you like working with people and being part of the creative scene, volunteering in arts and creative organisations might be for you. The roles vary: from attending group meetings, liasing with councils, helping with event set up, backstage etc to engaging with clients in friendly, professional manner, taking part in theatre/ dance workshop, rehearsals and performances and so on.

name: Help kids and youth
description: Enhance the lives of disadvantaged children by providing urgent aid, outreach, social justice advocacy and education tools to faciliate long term change. Get involved at an early years centre or provide support for young mums. Lend a hand with meal delviery or raise spirits with centre visits.

name: Translation work
description: Become a community support volunteer and work with those whose English is not their mother tongue. Tasks include assisting with translation and adhoc work and engaging in conversations in their native language. You willl love working with people, have strong interpersonal and intercultural compentency and be multilingual.

name: Volunteer driving
description: Have a valid driver's license and love to drive? You can choose to be a delivery volunteer or a driver volunteer for non-profits. You may be delivering a hot meal to those in need or helping with moving or relocating and general operations. In these roles, you may need to be physically fit and help with manual handling and emptying donations bin.

name: Handy person
description: If you love DIY, consider volunteering your skills for organisations and people in need. Volunteers may give their time to help older or disabled residents remain in their home for as long as they want. You may carry out jobs like changing lightbulbs, hanging out curtains, pictures and mirrors as well as building flat packs. Or you could join heritge building sites and assist with lawn mowing, bush cutting, plumbing and building repairs, painting work etc.

name: Donate food, money or gifts
description: Sometimes, it can be hard to find the time in our busy lives to volunteer. But you can still make a difference by donating food, money, gifts, or goods to organisations. Your contributions will help to support these organisations to continue making a positive impact in the society.

name: Refugee support
description: Make a difference to the lives of people seeking asylum. You will provide support to refugees and humanitarian entrants settling in Australia, including one-on-one casework, orientation and housing support. You may be called on to help with administrative tasks, assisting them with learning English, settling in the community and finding job opportunities.

name: Social support and counselling
description:
This line of work is open to people with all experience, depending on the type of role. On the one end, you could be providing phone support - you'll need to be friendly, empathetic, love having a chat about everyday topics. Callers tend to be those who experience loneliness and by chatting to them, they will already feel less lonely, making it easier for them to cope. 
On the other end, the crisis intervention or counselling service e.g. suicide helpline will require you to have qualifications and experince in counselling, social work or psychology.

name: Soup kitchen and food bank
description: All things food-related! Volunteering in soup kitchens will see you helping with food prep, cooking and serving warm meals to those in need. Soup kitchens bring people together to connect over a meal and engage in conversations, making the day a little better and a little less lonely. Or you could volunteer at food bank, working in grocery stores providing discounted or free pantry for those in need.

name: Environment and nature conservation
description: This mission is more critical than ever with man-made climate change posing existential threat to humanity. The earth continues to warm at an alarming rate with global leaders being too slow to take a real, meaningful step towards addressing climate change. The natural environment is being destroyed at an unprecedented level, with deforestration driving animal species to extinction and destabilising the climate and the ecosystem. Then there's the issue of sustainability, marine biodiversity and waste pollution - the list goes on. It can feel like an insurmountable challenge, but we must remain optimistic and do what we can even if it feels like our actions are too small to make a difference. If we can band together and each of us making a difference, this can create a massive change.

name: Surf-life saving
description: If you love being outdoor or in the water, there's volunteering opportunity for you. If you love the water, you can learn to become a surf rescue. If water is not your thing, you can learn to save lives as a first aider on the beach. Short term volunteering opportunities may include event photographer, historian, or being a part of the gear and equipment team.

name: Health emergency support (nurses/ paramedics/ doctors)
description: Trained doctors, nurses, therapists, paramedics or health workers can volunteer their critical skills to save lives. You might work for medical humanitarian organisation that delivers emergency aid to people affected by war, epidemics, healthcare exclusion or natural or man-made disasters. The nature of work is fast-paced and unpredictable, so you'll need to be able to work well under pressure and act quickly when disaster strikes.

name: Local community events and festivals
description: Contribute to a stronger community feel by volunteering your time and skills at events and festivals you care about. It's a great way to meet other locals in the area and foster a sense of connection in the neighbourhood. You'll volunteer your skills in different ways - photography, stage support, traffic and stall marshall, festival surveyors and so on.

name: Administration
description: All organisations rely on great administrators to be able to operate efficiently and effectively. If you possess excellent organisation skills, great with phones and bookkeeping and have basic marketing skills, you can volunteer as office admin or receptionist.

name: Sports and recreation
description: If you love fitness, sports and being outdoor, you can volunteer as team coach. You might supervise a team of athletes or train a group of kids learning to play football. You can also further your coaching development along the way.

name: Job support
description: Support those in need of employment with skills and training to become more job-ready. You can help with resume review, interview practice and role-play or connecting them with employment agencies.

name: Become an organ doner
description:
Organ donation is a rare event. It can only occur when someone dies is a hospital ICU or ED as organs must be working well to be able to be transplanted.  Currently, only 1 in 3 Australians are registered as an organ and tissue donor. So consider becoming a donor today - it takes just 1 minute to register to become a donor and in doing so, you can save up to 7 lives. 

Due to Covid-19, 2020-2021 saw a significant reduction in the number of deceased organ donors and transplant recipients. Transplants can lend a new lease on life to those in need. Interesting fact: 9 out of 10 families gave consent to donation when their family member was registered to be a donor. This dropped to only 4 out of 10 families who gave consent to donation when their family didn't know they wanted to be a donor. Takeway: register to be a donor and tell your family you want to be a donor.

name: Participate in clinical research
description:
Healthy volunteers are essential to the development of new technologies and treatments in medicine. In fact, without healthy volunteers participating in clinical trials, no new therapies, medicines, diagnostics or devices can be released for use by healthcare providers or patients. Being a healthy volunteer in a clinical trial is a remarkable gift that can have a positive impact on thousands, even millions, of lives and generations for years to come. 

Healthy volunteers are required at stage or phase I of the three chronological phase clinical trial process. In phase II and II, clinical trials require people who are diagnosed with and managing a specific disease or disorder.
